column4: I have a problem with the nvidia-driver in Breezy.. anyone here who can help me?
possibly ask away
did you follow any ubuntu guides or just the guide from the nvidia site?
yep, tried them both.. (tried some other things too).. but nothing worked... log looks rather fine, no errors and stuff
btw, it was working fine in warty and hoary...
k
I'm not sure about what the problem is.  Without walking through it step by step.
how about you pick a guide and work your way through it again
and report here and the process
this is what I first did (after a clean install of Breezy this morning):
paste in #flood
installed nvidia-glx, ran nvidia-glx-config enable and restarted X... this gave me the black screen and no reaction
and now you are trying to install the commercial drivers?

I've just tried those.. downloaded NVIDIA-Linux-x86-1.0-7667-pkg1.run (latest 7676 gave mismatch), executed it succesfully, changed xorg.conf according to the nvidia readme.. this gave the same result as before
yes
bummer...I'm at a loss
this is all I have for you https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
did that already...
yeah...sorry..i
nope ;) tnx for listening ;)
np
